channel.title: research on Makrand Khanwale
channel.description: Recent content in research on Makrand Khanwale

item.title: An adaptive block solver for simulating two-phase flows
item.description: Summary In our recent work on block-solver for simulating two-phase flows with deforming interfaces at various density contrasts by solving thermodynamically consistent Cahn-Hilliard Navier-Stokes equations. We use fully implicit non-linear finite element based methods. Highlights of the work Two-phase flows simulated using thermodynamically consistent Cahn-Hilliard Navier-Stokes equations. Provably energy-stable Crank-Nicolson-type time integration scheme. Continuous Galerkin finite element with variational multi-scale (VMS) used. Deployed a parallel numerical implementation using fast octree-based adaptive meshes.

item.title: An adaptive block solver for simulating two-phase flows
item.description: Write a bunch of things about the block paper.
